ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Conduct problems Scale-raw score
Notes: Average of items 5, 7 reverse coded, 12, 18, 22 multiplied by 5

ElementDescription: Conduct problems Scale-t-score
Notes: 0 = Close to average; 1 = Slightly raised; 2 = High; 3 = Very High

ElementDescription: Emotional Problems Scale-raw score
Notes: Average of items 3, 8, 13, 16, 24 multiplied by 5

ElementDescription: Emotional Problems Scale-T-score
Notes: 0 = Close to average; 1 = Slightly raised; 2 = High; 3 = Very High

ElementDescription: Hyperactivity scale-raw score
Notes: Average of items 2, 10, 15, 21 reverse coded, 25 multiplied by 5

ElementDescription: Hyperactivity scale-T-score
Notes: 0 = Close to average; 1 = Slightly raised; 2 = High; 3 = Very High

ElementDescription: Impact score-Raw score
Notes: Average of reverse coded items 28, 29, 30 multiplied by 3; 999= Missing/NA

ElementDescription: Impact score-T score
Notes: 0 = Close to average; 1 = Slightly raised; 2 = High; 3 = Very High

ElementDescription: Peer problems scale-raw score
Notes: Average of items 6, 11 reverse coded, 14 reverse coded, 16, 23

ElementDescription: Peer problems scale-T-score
Notes: 0 = Close to average; 1 = Slightly raised; 2 = High; 3 = Very High

ElementDescription: Total difficulties score-raw score
Notes: Sum of items p_yc_sdq_em_rs, p_yc_sdq_co_rs, p_yc_sdq_hy_rs,  p_yc_sdq_pe_rs

ElementDescription: Total difficulties score-T-score
Notes: 0 = Close to average; 1 = Slightly raised; 2 = High; 3 = Very High

ElementDescription: Prosocial scale-Raw score
Notes: Average of items 1, 4, 9, 17, 20 multiplied by 5

ElementDescription: Prosocial scale-T-score
Notes: 0 = Close to average; 1 = Slightly raised; 2 = High; 3 = Very High

ElementDescription: Strength and Difficulties - Report Internalizing Symptoms
Notes: Sum Emotional Problems and Peer Relationship Problems

ElementDescription: Strength and Difficulties - Report Externalizing Symptoms
Notes: Sum Conduct Problems and Hyperactivity/Inattention
